revised_title: Late Proterozoic Cratonization in Southwest Saudi Arabia
tldr: This article discusses the geological history and cratonization of the southwestern part of the Arabian Shield in Saudi Arabia. It presents a revised stratigraphy and interprets the orogenic events that occurred between 1050 and 550 million years ago, including three main episodes of tectonic activity, volcanic and sedimentary deposition, and plutonic rock formation. The study suggests that cratonization evolved in an intraoceanic, island-arc environment.
